exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

feedHeader.label: advanced
feedHeader.description: Sets whether to add the feed object as a header.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

Component.description: Consume events from Amazon Cloudtrail using AWS SDK version 2.x.

component.name: aws-cloudtrail
component.title: AWS Cloudtrail
component.description: Consume events from Amazon Cloudtrail using AWS SDK version 2.x.
component.label: cloud,management,monitoring

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

eventSource.description: Specify an event source to select events

maxResults.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

region.description: The region in which Cloudtrail client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

cloudTrailClient.label: advanced
cloudTrailClient.description: Amazon Cloudtrail client to use for all requests for this endpoint

healthCheckConsumerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckConsumerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

healthCheckProducerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckProducerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

proxyHost.label: proxy
proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Cloudtrail client

proxyPort.label: proxy
proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Cloudtrail client

proxyProtocol.label: proxy
proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Cloudtrail client

profileCredentialsName.label: security
profileCredentialsName.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

trustAllCertificates.label: security
trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

useDefaultCredentialsProvider.label: security
useDefaultCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Cloudtrail client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

useProfileCredentialsProvider.label: security
useProfileCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Cloudtrail client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

label.description: A label for indexing cloudtrail endpoints

eventSource.description: Specify an event source to select events

maxResults.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

region.description: The region in which Cloudtrail client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

cloudTrailClient.label: advanced
cloudTrailClient.description: Amazon Cloudtrail client to use for all requests for this endpoint

proxyHost.label: proxy
proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Cloudtrail client

proxyPort.label: proxy
proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Cloudtrail client

proxyProtocol.label: proxy
proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Cloudtrail client

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

profileCredentialsName.label: security
profileCredentialsName.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

trustAllCertificates.label: security
trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

useDefaultCredentialsProvider.label: security
useDefaultCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Cloudtrail client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

useProfileCredentialsProvider.label: security
useProfileCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Cloudtrail client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

Component.name: aws-secrets-manager

component.name: aws-secrets-manager
component.title: AWS Secrets Manager

binaryPayload.description: Set if the secret is binary or not

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

operation.description: The operation to perform

overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

region.description: The region in which Secrets Manager client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

useProfileCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Secrets Manager client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

Component.name: aws2-athena
Component.title: AWS Athena
Component.description: Access AWS Athena.

component.name: aws2-athena
component.title: AWS Athena
component.description: Access AWS Athena.
component.label: cloud,database

delay.description: Milliseconds before the next poll for query execution status. See the section Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries to learn more.

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll for query execution status. See the section Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries to learn more.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

maxAttempts.label: producer
maxAttempts.description: Maximum number of times to attempt a query. Set to 1 to disable retries. See the section Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries to learn more.

maxResults.description: Max number of results to return for the given operation (if supported by the Athena API endpoint). If not set, will use the Athena API default for the given operation.

nextToken.description: Pagination token to use in the case where the response from the previous request was truncated.

operation.description: The Athena API function to call.

outputLocation.description: The location in Amazon S3 where query results are stored, such as s3://path/to/query/bucket/. Ensure this value ends with a forward slash.

outputType.description: How query results should be returned. One of StreamList (default - return a GetQueryResultsIterable that can page through all results), SelectList (returns at most 1000 rows at a time, plus a NextToken value as a header than can be used for manual pagination of results), S3Pointer (return an S3 path pointing to the results).

queryExecutionId.description: The unique ID identifying the query execution.

queryString.description: The SQL query to run. Except for simple queries, prefer setting this as the body of the Exchange or as a header using Athena2Constants.QUERY_STRING to avoid having to deal with URL encoding issues.

region.description: The region in which Athena client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1).

resetWaitTimeoutOnRetry.label: producer
resetWaitTimeoutOnRetry.description: Reset the waitTimeout countdown in the event of a query retry. If set to true, potential max time spent waiting for queries is equal to waitTimeout x maxAttempts. See the section Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries to learn more.

retry.label: producer
retry.description: Optional comma separated list of error types to retry the query for. Use: 'retryable' to retry all retryable failure conditions (e.g. generic errors and resources exhausted), 'generic' to retry 'GENERIC_INTERNAL_ERROR' failures, 'exhausted' to retry queries that have exhausted resource limits, 'always' to always retry regardless of failure condition, or 'never' or null to never retry (default). See the section Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries to learn more.

waitTimeout.description: Optional max wait time in millis to wait for a successful query completion. See the section Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries to learn more.

workGroup.description: The workgroup to use for running the query.

amazonAthenaClient.label: advanced
amazonAthenaClient.description: The AmazonAthena instance to use as the client.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

clientRequestToken.label: advanced
clientRequestToken.description: A unique string to ensure issues queries are idempotent. It is unlikely you will need to set this.

includeTrace.label: advanced
includeTrace.description: Include useful trace information at the beginning of queries as an SQL comment (prefixed with --).

healthCheckConsumerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckConsumerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

healthCheckProducerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckProducerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

proxyHost.label: proxy
proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Athena client.

proxyPort.label: proxy
proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Athena client.

proxyProtocol.label: proxy
proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Athena client.

encryptionOption.label: security
encryptionOption.description: The encryption type to use when storing query results in S3. One of SSE_S3, SSE_KMS, or CSE_KMS.

kmsKey.label: security
kmsKey.description: For SSE-KMS and CSE-KMS, this is the KMS key ARN or ID.

profileCredentialsName.label: security
profileCredentialsName.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name

useDefaultCredentialsProvider.label: security
useDefaultCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Athena client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in

useProfileCredentialsProvider.label: security
useProfileCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Athena client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

CamelAwsAthenaOperation.label: all
CamelAwsAthenaOperation.description: The operation to perform. Permitted values are getQueryExecution, getQueryResults, listQueryExecutions, startQueryExecution.

CamelAwsAthenaQueryExecutionId.label: getQueryExecution getQueryResults startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaQueryExecutionId.description: The unique ID identifying the query execution.

CamelAwsAthenaWorkGroup.label: listQueryExecutions startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaWorkGroup.description: The workgroup to use for running the query.

CamelAwsAthenaNextToken.label: getQueryResults listQueryExecutions
CamelAwsAthenaNextToken.description: Pagination token to use in the case where the response from the previous request was truncated.

CamelAwsAthenaMaxResults.label: getQueryResults listQueryExecutions
CamelAwsAthenaMaxResults.description: Max number of results to return for the given operation (if supported by the Athena API endpoint). If not set, will use the Athena API default for the given operation.

CamelAwsAthenaIncludeTrace.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaIncludeTrace.description: Include useful trace information at the beginning of queries as an SQL comment (prefixed with --).

CamelAwsAthenaOutputLocation.label: getQueryExecution getQueryResults startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaOutputLocation.description: The location in Amazon S3 where query results are stored, such as s3://path/to/query/bucket/. Ensure this value ends with a forward slash ('/').

CamelAwsAthenaOutputType.label: getQueryResults
CamelAwsAthenaOutputType.description: How query results should be returned. One of StreamList (default - return a GetQueryResultsIterable that can page through all results), SelectList (returns at most 1,000 rows at a time, plus a NextToken value as a header than can be used for manual pagination of results), S3Pointer (return an S3 path pointing to the results).

CamelAwsAthenaQueryExecutionState.label: getQueryExecution getQueryResults startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaQueryExecutionState.description: The state of the query execution.

CamelAwsAthenaClientRequestToken.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaClientRequestToken.description: A unique string to ensure issues queries are idempotent. It is unlikely you will need to set this.

CamelAwsAthenaQueryString.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaQueryString.description: The SQL query to run. Except for simple queries, prefer setting this as the body of the Exchange or as this header to avoid having to deal with URL encoding issues.

CamelAwsAthenaEncryptionOption.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaEncryptionOption.description: The encryption type to use when storing query results in S3.

CamelAwsAthenaKmsKey.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaKmsKey.description: For SSE-KMS and CSE-KMS, this is the KMS key ARN or ID.

CamelAwsAthenaWaitTimeout.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaWaitTimeout.description: Optional max wait time in millis to wait for a successful query completion. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

CamelAwsAthenaInitialDelay.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaInitialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll for query execution status. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

CamelAwsAthenaDelay.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaDelay.description: Milliseconds before the next poll for query execution status. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

CamelAwsAthenaMaxAttempts.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaMaxAttempts.description: Maximum number of times to attempt a query. Set to 1 to disable retries. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

CamelAwsAthenaRetry.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaRetry.description: Optional comma separated list of error types to retry the query for. Use 'retryable' to retry all retryable failure conditions (e.g. generic errors and resources exhausted), 'generic' to retry 'GENERIC_INTERNAL_ERROR' failures, 'exhausted' to retry queries that have exhausted resource limits, 'always' to always retry regardless of failure condition, or 'never' or null to never retry (default). See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

CamelAwsAthenaResetWaitTimeoutOnRetry.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaResetWaitTimeoutOnRetry.description: Reset the waitTimeout countdown in the event of a query retry. If set to true, potential max time spent waiting for queries is equal to waitTimeout x maxAttempts. See the section 'Waiting for Query Completion and Retrying Failed Queries' to learn more.

CamelAwsAthenaStartQueryExecutionAttempt.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaStartQueryExecutionAttempt.description: Total number of attempts made to run the query. Will be greater than 1 if the query is retried.

CamelAwsAthenaStartQueryExecutionElapsed.label: startQueryExecution
CamelAwsAthenaStartQueryExecutionElapsed.description: Total time in millis taken in startQueryExecution (mostly relevant when waiting for query completion within startQueryExecution).

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

iteratorType.label: consumer
iteratorType.description: Defines where in the Kinesis stream to start getting records

maxResultsPerRequest.label: consumer
maxResultsPerRequest.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

sequenceNumber.label: consumer
sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number to start polling from. Required if iteratorType is set to AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

shardClosed.label: consumer
shardClosed.description: Define what will be the behavior in case of shard closed. Possible value are ignore, silent and fail. In case of ignore a message will be logged and the consumer will restart from the beginning,in case of silent there will be no logging and the consumer will start from the beginning,in case of fail a ReachedClosedStateException will be raised

CamelAwsKinesisApproximateArrivalTimesta.description: The time AWS assigned as the arrival time of the record.

CamelAwsKinesisPartitionKey.description: Identifies which shard in the stream the data record is assigned to.

CamelAwsKinesisShardId.description: The shard ID of the shard where the data record was placed.

cborEnabled.label: common
cborEnabled.description: This option will set the CBOR_ENABLED property during the execution

overrideEndpoint.label: common
overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

region.description: The region in which Kinesis Firehose client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

uriEndpointOverride.label: common
uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

iteratorType.label: consumer
iteratorType.description: Defines where in the Kinesis stream to start getting records

maxResultsPerRequest.label: consumer
maxResultsPerRequest.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

sequenceNumber.label: consumer
sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number to start polling from. Required if iteratorType is set to AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

shardClosed.label: consumer
shardClosed.description: Define what will be the behavior in case of shard closed. Possible value are ignore, silent and fail. In case of ignore a message will be logged and the consumer will restart from the beginning,in case of silent there will be no logging and the consumer will start from the beginning,in case of fail a ReachedClosedStateException will be raised

shardId.label: consumer
shardId.description: Defines which shardId in the Kinesis stream to get records from

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

amazonKinesisClient.label: advanced
amazonKinesisClient.description: Amazon Kinesis client to use for all requests for this endpoint

asyncClient.label: advanced
asyncClient.description: If we want to a KinesisAsyncClient instance set it to true

proxyHost.label: proxy
proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Kinesis client

proxyPort.label: proxy
proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Kinesis client

proxyProtocol.label: proxy
proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Kinesis client

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

profileCredentialsName.label: security
profileCredentialsName.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

trustAllCertificates.label: security
trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

useDefaultCredentialsProvider.label: security
useDefaultCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Kinesis client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

useProfileCredentialsProvider.label: security
useProfileCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the Kinesis client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

CamelAwsLambdaS3Bucket.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaS3Bucket.description: Amazon S3 bucket name where the .zip file containing your deployment package is stored. This bucket must reside in the same AWS region where you are creating the Lambda function.

CamelAwsLambdaS3Key.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaS3Key.description: The Amazon S3 object (the deployment package) key name you want to upload.

CamelAwsLambdaS3ObjectVersion.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaS3ObjectVersion.description: The Amazon S3 object (the deployment package) version you want to upload.

CamelAwsLambdaZipFile.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaZipFile.description: The local path of the zip file (the deployment package). Content of zip file can also be put in Message body.

CamelAwsLambdaRole.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaRole.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Lambda assumes when it executes your function to access any other Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources.

CamelAwsLambdaRuntime.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaRuntime.description: The runtime environment for the Lambda function you are uploading. (nodejs, nodejs4.3, nodejs6.10, java8, python2.7, python3.6, dotnetcore1.0, odejs4.3-edge)

CamelAwsLambdaHandler.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaHandler.description: The function within your code that Lambda calls to begin execution. For Node.js, it is the module-name.export value in your function. For Java, it can be package.class-name::handler or package.class-name.

CamelAwsLambdaTargetArn.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaTargetArn.description: The parent object that contains the target ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

CamelAwsLambdaMemorySize.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaMemorySize.description: The memory size, in MB, you configured for the function. Must be a multiple of 64 MB.

CamelAwsLambdaKMSKeyArn.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaKMSKeyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt your function's environment variables. If not provided, AWS Lambda will use a default service key.

CamelAwsLambdaEnvironmentVariables.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaEnvironmentVariables.description: The key-value pairs that represent your environment's configuration settings.

CamelAwsLambdaPublish.label: createFunction updateFunction
CamelAwsLambdaPublish.description: This boolean parameter can be used to request AWS Lambda to create the Lambda function and publish a version as an atomic operation.

CamelAwsLambdaTimeout.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaTimeout.description: The function execution time at which Lambda should terminate the function. The default is 3 seconds.

CamelAwsLambdaTags.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaTags.description: The list of tags (key-value pairs) assigned to the new function.

CamelAwsLambdaTracingConfig.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaTracingConfig.description: Your function's tracing settings (Active or PassThrough).

CamelAwsLambdaSecurityGroupIds.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaSecurityGroupIds.description: If your Lambda function accesses resources in a VPC, a list of one or more security groups IDs in your VPC.

CamelAwsLambdaSubnetIds.label: createFunction
CamelAwsLambdaSubnetIds.description: If your Lambda function accesses resources in a VPC, a list of one or more subnet IDs in your VPC.

CamelAwsLambdaEventSourceArn.label: createEventSourceMapping
CamelAwsLambdaEventSourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event source.

CamelAwsLambdaEventSourceBatchSize.label: createEventSourceMapping
CamelAwsLambdaEventSourceBatchSize.description: The maximum number of records in each batch that Lambda pulls from your stream or queue and sends to your function.

CamelAwsLambdaEventSourceUuid.label: deleteEventSourceMapping
CamelAwsLambdaEventSourceUuid.description: The identifier of the event source mapping.

CamelAwsLambdaResourceTags.label: tagResource
CamelAwsLambdaResourceTags.description: A list of tags to apply to the function.

CamelAwsLambdaResourceTagKeys.label: untagResource
CamelAwsLambdaResourceTagKeys.description: A list of tag keys to remove from the function.

CamelAwsLambdaVersionDescription.label: publishVersion
CamelAwsLambdaVersionDescription.description: A description for the version to override the description in the function configuration.

CamelAwsLambdaVersionRevisionId.label: publishVersion
CamelAwsLambdaVersionRevisionId.description: Only update the function if the revision ID matches the ID that's specified.

CamelAwsLambdaFunctionVersion.label: createAlias listAliases
CamelAwsLambdaFunctionVersion.description: The function version to set in the alias

CamelAwsLambdaAliasFunctionName.label: createAlias deleteAlias getAlias
CamelAwsLambdaAliasFunctionName.description: The function name of the alias

CamelAwsLambdaAliasFunctionDescription.label: createAlias
CamelAwsLambdaAliasFunctionDescription.description: The function description to set in the alias

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

component.title: AWS S3 Storage Service
component.description: Store and retrieve objects from AWS S3 Storage Service.
component.label: cloud,file

autoCreateBucket.label: common
autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the S3 bucket bucketName. This will apply also in case of moveAfterRead option enabled and it will create the destinationBucket if it doesn't exist already.

delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

forcePathStyle.description: Set whether the S3 client should use path-style URL instead of virtual-hosted-style

overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

prefix.description: The prefix which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

customerAlgorithm.label: common,advanced
customerAlgorithm.description: Define the customer algorithm to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

customerKeyId.label: common,advanced
customerKeyId.description: Define the id of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

customerKeyMD5.label: common,advanced
customerKeyMD5.description: Define the MD5 of Customer key to use in case CustomerKey is enabled

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

deleteAfterRead.label: consumer
deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from S3 after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the AWS2S3Constants#BUCKET_NAME and AWS2S3Constants#KEY headers, or only the AWS2S3Constants#KEY header.

destinationBucket.label: consumer
destinationBucket.description: Define the destination bucket where an object must be moved when moveAfterRead is set to true.

destinationBucketPrefix.label: consumer
destinationBucketPrefix.description: Define the destination bucket prefix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

destinationBucketSuffix.label: consumer
destinationBucketSuffix.description: Define the destination bucket suffix to use when an object must be moved and moveAfterRead is set to true.

doneFileName.label: consumer
doneFileName.description: If provided, Camel will only consume files if a done file exists.

fileName.label: consumer
fileName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given file name

ignoreBody.label: consumer
ignoreBody.description: If it is true, the S3 Object Body will be ignored completely, if it is set to false the S3 Object will be put in the body. Setting this to true, will override any behavior defined by includeBody option.

includeBody.label: consumer
includeBody.description: If it is true, the S3Object exchange will be consumed and put into the body and closed. If false the S3Object stream will be put raw into the body and the headers will be set with the S3 object metadata. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true because the S3Object stream will be consumed then it will also be closed, while in case of includeBody false then it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. However setting autocloseBody to true when includeBody is false it will schedule to close the S3Object stream automatically on exchange completion.

includeFolders.label: consumer
includeFolders.description: If it is true, the folders/directories will be consumed. If it is false, they will be ignored, and Exchanges will not be created for those

moveAfterRead.label: consumer
moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from S3 bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.

autocloseBody.label: consumer,advanced
autocloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is false, then the S3Object.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to false and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

batchMessageNumber.label: producer
batchMessageNumber.description: The number of messages composing a batch in streaming upload mode

batchSize.label: producer
batchSize.description: The batch size (in bytes) in streaming upload mode

bufferSize.label: producer
bufferSize.description: The buffer size (in bytes) in streaming upload mode

deleteAfterWrite.label: producer
deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the S3 file has been uploaded

keyName.label: producer
keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

multiPartUpload.label: producer
multiPartUpload.description: If it is true, camel will upload the file with multi part format, the part size is decided by the option of partSize

namingStrategy.label: producer
namingStrategy.description: The naming strategy to use in streaming upload mode

operation.label: producer

partSize.label: producer

restartingPolicy.description: The restarting policy to use in streaming upload mode

streamingUploadMode.label: producer
streamingUploadMode.description: When stream mode is true the upload to bucket will be done in streaming

streamingUploadTimeout.label: producer
streamingUploadTimeout.description: While streaming upload mode is true, this option set the timeout to complete upload

awsKMSKeyId.description: Define the id of KMS key to use in case KMS is enabled

This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

CamelAwsS3BucketName.description: The bucket Name which this object will be stored or which will be used for the current operation or in which this object is contained.

CamelAwsS3BucketDestinationName.label: producer
CamelAwsS3BucketDestinationName.description: The bucket Destination Name which will be used for the current operation

CamelAwsS3ContentControl.description: The optional Cache-Control HTTP header which allows the user to specify caching behavior along the HTTP request/reply chain.

CamelAwsS3ContentDisposition.description: The optional Content-Disposition HTTP header, which specifies presentational information such as the recommended filename for the object to be saved as.

CamelAwsS3ContentEncoding.description: The optional Content-Encoding HTTP header specifying what content encodings have been applied to the object and what decoding mechanisms must be applied in order to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type field.

CamelAwsS3ContentLength.description: The Content-Length HTTP header indicating the size of the associated object in bytes.

CamelAwsS3ContentMD5.description: The base64 encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the associated object (content - not including headers) according to RFC 1864. This data is used as a message integrity check to verify that the data received by Amazon S3 is the same data that the caller sent.

CamelAwsS3ContentType.description: The Content-Type HTTP header, which indicates the type of content stored in the associated object. The value of this header is a standard MIME type.

CamelAwsS3ETag.description: (producer) The ETag value for the newly uploaded object. (consumer) The hex encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the associated object according to RFC 1864. This data is used as an integrity check to verify that the data received by the caller is the same data that was sent by Amazon S3.

CamelAwsS3Key.description: The key under which this object is stored or will be stored or which will be used for the current operation

CamelAwsS3DestinationKey.label: producer
CamelAwsS3DestinationKey.description: The Destination key which will be used for the current operation

CamelAwsS3LastModified.description: The value of the Last-Modified header, indicating the date and time at which Amazon S3 last recorded a modification to the associated object.

CamelAwsS3StorageClass.description: The storage class of this object.

CamelAwsS3VersionId.description: (producer) The optional version ID of the newly uploaded object. (consumer) The version ID of the associated Amazon S3 object if available. Version IDs are only assigned to objects when an object is uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket that has object versioning enabled.

CamelAwsS3CannedAcl.label: producer
CamelAwsS3CannedAcl.description: The canned acl that will be applied to the object. see software.amazon.awssdk.services.s3.model.ObjectCannedACL for allowed values.

CamelAwsS3Acl.label: producer
CamelAwsS3Acl.description: A well constructed Amazon S3 Access Control List object.

CamelAwsS3Operation.description: The operation to perform. Permitted values are copyObject, deleteObject, listBuckets, deleteBucket, listObjects

CamelAwsS3ServerSideEncryption.description: Sets the server-side encryption algorithm when encrypting the object using AWS-managed keys. For example use AES256.

CamelAwsS3ExpirationTime.label: consumer
CamelAwsS3ExpirationTime.description: If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the response includes this header.

CamelAwsS3ReplicationStatus.label: consumer
CamelAwsS3ReplicationStatus.description: Amazon S3 can return this if your request involves a bucket that is either a source or destination in a replication rule.

CamelAwsS3RangeStart.description: The position of the first byte to get

CamelAwsS3DowloadLinkExpirationTime.label: producer
CamelAwsS3DowloadLinkExpirationTime.description: The expiration time of the download link in milliseconds

maxMessagesPerPoll.label: consumer

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

cc.description: List of comma separated destination carbon copy (cc) email address. Can be overridden with 'CamelAwsSesCc' header.

configurationSet.description: Set the configuration set to send with every request. Override it with 'CamelAwsSesConfigurationSet' header.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

region.description: The region in which SES client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

replyToAddresses.description: List of comma separated reply-to email address(es) for the message, override it using 'CamelAwsSesReplyToAddresses' header.

returnPath.description: The email address to which bounce notifications are to be forwarded, override it using 'CamelAwsSesReturnPath' header.

subject.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSesSubject' is not present.

to.description: List of comma separated destination email address. Can be overridden with 'CamelAwsSesTo' header.

uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

amazonSESClient.label: advanced
amazonSESClient.description: To use the AmazonSimpleEmailService as the client

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

healthCheckConsumerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckConsumerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

healthCheckProducerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckProducerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

component.title: AWS Simple Queue Service (SQS)
component.description: Send and receive messages to/from AWS SQS.
component.label: cloud,messaging

amazonAWSHost.description: The hostname of the Amazon AWS cloud.

autoCreateQueue.description: Setting the autocreation of the queue

overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

protocol.description: The underlying protocol used to communicate with SQS

queueOwnerAWSAccountId.description: Specify the queue owner aws account id when you need to connect the queue with different account owner.

region.description: The region in which SQS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

attributeNames.label: consumer
attributeNames.description: A list of attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

concurrentConsumers.label: consumer
concurrentConsumers.description: Allows you to use multiple threads to poll the sqs queue to increase throughput

deleteAfterRead.label: consumer
deleteAfterRead.description: Delete message from SQS after it has been read

deleteIfFiltered.label: consumer
deleteIfFiltered.description: Whether or not to send the DeleteMessage to the SQS queue if the exchange has property with key Sqs2Constants#SQS_DELETE_FILTERED (CamelAwsSqsDeleteFiltered) set to true.

extendMessageVisibility.label: consumer
extendMessageVisibility.description: If enabled then a scheduled background task will keep extending the message visibility on SQS. This is needed if it takes a long time to process the message. If set to true defaultVisibilityTimeout must be set. See details at Amazon docs.

kmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds.displayName: Kms Data Key Reuse Period Seconds
kmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds.label: consumer
kmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds.description: The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling AWS KMS again. An integer representing seconds, between 60 seconds (1 minute) and 86,400 seconds (24 hours). Default: 300 (5 minutes).

kmsMasterKeyId.label: consumer
kmsMasterKeyId.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SQS or a custom CMK.

messageAttributeNames.label: consumer
messageAttributeNames.description: A list of message attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

serverSideEncryptionEnabled.label: consumer
serverSideEncryptionEnabled.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the queue

visibilityTimeout.label: consumer
visibilityTimeout.description: The duration (in seconds) that the received messages are hidden from subsequent retrieve requests after being retrieved by a ReceiveMessage request to set in the com.amazonaws.services.sqs.model.SetQueueAttributesRequest. This only make sense if its different from defaultVisibilityTimeout. It changes the queue visibility timeout attribute permanently.

waitTimeSeconds.label: consumer
waitTimeSeconds.description: Duration in seconds (0 to 20) that the ReceiveMessage action call will wait until a message is in the queue to include in the response.

batchSeparator.label: producer
batchSeparator.description: Set the separator when passing a String to send batch message operation

delaySeconds.label: producer
delaySeconds.description: Delay sending messages for a number of seconds.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

messageDeduplicationIdStrategy.label: producer
messageDeduplicationIdStrategy.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageDeduplicationId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useExchangeId, useContentBasedDeduplication. For the useContentBasedDeduplication option, no messageDeduplicationId will be set on the message.

messageGroupIdStrategy.label: producer
messageGroupIdStrategy.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageGroupId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useConstant, useExchangeId, usePropertyValue. For the usePropertyValue option, the value of property CamelAwsMessageGroupId will be used.

messageHeaderExceededLimit.label: producer
messageHeaderExceededLimit.description: What to do if sending to AWS SQS has more messages than AWS allows (currently only maximum 10 message headers is allowed). WARN will log a WARN about the limit is for each additional header, so the message can be sent to AWS. WARN_ONCE will only log one time a WARN about the limit is hit, and drop additional headers, so the message can be sent to AWS. IGNORE will ignore (no logging) and drop additional headers, so the message can be sent to AWS. FAIL will cause an exception to be thrown and the message is not sent to AWS.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to send only a message

messageRetentionPeriod.label: queue

policy.label: queue
policy.description: The policy for this queue. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

queueUrl.label: queue
queueUrl.description: To define the queueUrl explicitly. All other parameters, which would influence the queueUrl, are ignored. This parameter is intended to be used, to connect to a mock implementation of SQS, for testing purposes.

proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SQS client

proxyProtocol.label: proxy
proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SQS client

maximumMessageSize.label: queue
maximumMessageSize.description: The maximumMessageSize (in bytes) an SQS message can contain for this queue.

messageRetentionPeriod.label: queue
messageRetentionPeriod.description: The messageRetentionPeriod (in seconds) a message will be retained by SQS for this queue.

policy.label: queue
policy.description: The policy for this queue. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

queueUrl.label: queue
queueUrl.description: To define the queueUrl explicitly. All other parameters, which would influence the queueUrl, are ignored. This parameter is intended to be used, to connect to a mock implementation of SQS, for testing purposes.

receiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds.label: queue
receiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds.description: If you do not specify WaitTimeSeconds in the request, the queue attribute ReceiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds is used to determine how long to wait.

redrivePolicy.label: queue
redrivePolicy.description: Specify the policy that send message to DeadLetter queue. See detail at Amazon docs.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

profileCredentialsName.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name

trustAllCertificates.label: security
trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

useDefaultCredentialsProvider.label: security
useDefaultCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

useProfileCredentialsProvider.label: security
useProfileCredentialsProvider.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
