Component.name: azure-storage-blob
Component.title: Azure Storage Blob Service
Component.description: Store and retrieve blobs from Azure Storage Blob Service.

component.name: azure-storage-blob
component.title: Azure Storage Blob Service
component.description: Store and retrieve blobs from Azure Storage Blob Service.
component.label: cloud,file

blobName.label: common
blobName.description: The blob name, to consume specific blob from a container. However, on producer it is only required for the operations on the blob level

blobOffset.label: common
blobOffset.description: Set the blob offset for the upload or download operations, default is 0

blobType.label: common
blobType.description: The blob type in order to initiate the appropriate settings for each blob type

closeStreamAfterRead.description: Close the stream after read or keep it open, default is true

credentials.description: StorageSharedKeyCredential can be injected to create the azure client, this holds the important authentication information

credentialType.label: common
credentialType.description: Determines the credential strategy to adopt

dataCount.label: common
dataCount.description: How many bytes to include in the range. Must be greater than or equal to 0 if specified.

fileDir.label: common
fileDir.description: The file directory where the downloaded blobs will be saved to, this can be used in both, producer and consumer

maxResultsPerPage.label: common
maxResultsPerPage.description: Specifies the maximum number of blobs to return, including all BlobPrefix elements. If the request does not specify maxResultsPerPage or specifies a value greater than 5,000, the server will return up to 5,000 items.

maxRetryRequests.label: common
maxRetryRequests.description: Specifies the maximum number of additional HTTP Get requests that will be made while reading the data from a response body.

prefix.label: common
prefix.description: Filters the results to return only blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix. May be null to return all blobs.

regex.label: common
regex.description: Filters the results to return only blobs whose names match the specified regular expression. May be null to return all if both prefix and regex are set, regex takes the priority and prefix is ignored.

serviceClient.description: Client to a storage account. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs and containers. This client contains operations on a service account. Operations on a container are available on BlobContainerClient through BlobServiceClient#getBlobContainerClient(String), and operations on a blob are available on BlobClient through BlobContainerClient#getBlobClient(String).

timeout.label: common
timeout.description: An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

blobSequenceNumber.label: producer
blobSequenceNumber.description: A user-controlled value that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 263 - 1.The default value is 0.

blockListType.label: producer
blockListType.description: Specifies which type of blocks to return.

changeFeedContext.label: producer
changeFeedContext.description: When using getChangeFeed producer operation, this gives additional context that is passed through the Http pipeline during the service call.

changeFeedEndTime.label: producer
changeFeedEndTime.description: When using getChangeFeed producer operation, this filters the results to return events approximately before the end time. Note: A few events belonging to the next hour can also be returned. A few events belonging to this hour can be missing; to ensure all events from the hour are returned, round the end time up by an hour.

changeFeedStartTime.label: producer
changeFeedStartTime.description: When using getChangeFeed producer operation, this filters the results to return events approximately after the start time. Note: A few events belonging to the previous hour can also be returned. A few events belonging to this hour can be missing; to ensure all events from the hour are returned, round the start time down by an hour.

closeStreamAfterWrite.label: producer
closeStreamAfterWrite.description: Close the stream after write or keep it open, default is true

commitBlockListLater.label: producer
commitBlockListLater.description: When is set to true, the staged blocks will not be committed directly.

createAppendBlob.label: producer
createAppendBlob.description: When is set to true, the append blocks will be created when committing append blocks.

createPageBlob.label: producer
createPageBlob.description: When is set to true, the page blob will be created when uploading page blob.

downloadLinkExpiration.label: producer
downloadLinkExpiration.description: Override the default expiration (millis) of URL download link.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: The blob operation that can be used with this component on the producer

pageBlobSize.label: producer
pageBlobSize.description: Specifies the maximum size for the page blob, up to 8 TB. The page blob size must be aligned to a 512-byte boundary.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

healthCheckConsumerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckConsumerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

healthCheckProducerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckProducerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure blob services

sourceBlobAccessKey.label: security
sourceBlobAccessKey.description: Source Blob Access Key: for copyblob operation, sadly, we need to have an accessKey for the source blob we want to copy Passing an accessKey as header, it's unsafe so we could set as key.

CamelAzureStorageBlobOperation.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobOperation.description: (All) Specify the producer operation to execute, please see the doc on this page related to producer operation.

CamelAzureStorageBlobHttpHeaders.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobHttpHeaders.description: (uploadBlockBlob, commitBlobBlockList, createAppendBlob, createPageBlob) Additional parameters for a set of operations.

CamelAzureStorageBlobETag.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobETag.description: The E Tag of the blob

CamelAzureStorageBlobLastModified.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobLastModified.description: Datetime when the blob was last modified.

CamelAzureStorageBlobContentType.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobContentType.description: Content type specified for the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobContentMD5.description: (producer) (Most operations related to upload blob) Most operations related to upload blobAn MD5 hash of the block content. This hash is used to verify the integrity of the block during transport. When this header is specified, the storage service compares the hash of the content that has arrived with this header value. Note that this MD5 hash is not stored with the blob. If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail. (consumer) Content MD5 specified for the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobContentEncoding.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobContentEncoding.description: Content encoding specified for the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobContentDisposition.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobContentDisposition.description: Content disposition specified for the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobContentLanguage.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobContentLanguage.description: Content language specified for the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCacheControl.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCacheControl.description: Cache control specified for the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobBlobUploadSize.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobBlobUploadSize.description: When uploading a blob with the uploadBlockBlob-operation this can be used to tell the client what the length of an InputStream is.

CamelAzureStorageBlobSequenceNumber.description: (producer) (createPageBlob) A user-controlled value that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 263 - 1. The default value is 0. (consumer) The current sequence number for a page blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobLeaseStatus.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobLeaseStatus.description: Status of the lease on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobLeaseState.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobLeaseState.description: State of the lease on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobLeaseDuration.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobLeaseDuration.description: Type of lease on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyId.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyId.description: Identifier of the last copy operation performed on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyStatus.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyStatus.description: Status of the last copy operation performed on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCopySource.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCopySource.description: Source of the last copy operation performed on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyProgress.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyProgress.description: Progress of the last copy operation performed on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyCompletionTime.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyCompletionTime.description: Datetime when the last copy operation on the blob completed.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyStatusDescripti.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyStatusDescripti.description: Description of the last copy operation on the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyDestinationSnap.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCopyDestinationSnap.description: Snapshot identifier of the last incremental copy snapshot for the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobIsServerEncrypted.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobIsServerEncrypted.description: Flag indicating if the blob's content is encrypted on the server.

CamelAzureStorageBlobIsIncrementalCopy.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobIsIncrementalCopy.description: Flag indicating if the blob was incrementally copied.

CamelAzureStorageBlobAccessTier.description: (producer) (uploadBlockBlob, commitBlobBlockList) Defines values for AccessTier. (consumer) Access tier of the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobIsAccessTierInferre.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobIsAccessTierInferre.description: Flag indicating if the access tier of the blob was inferred from properties of the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobaccessTierChangeTim.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobaccessTierChangeTim.description: Datetime when the access tier of the blob last changed.

CamelAzureStorageBlobMetadata.description: (producer) (Operations related to container and blob) Operations related to container and blob Metadata to associate with the container or blob. (consumer) Additional metadata associated with the blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCommittedBlockCount.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCommittedBlockCount.description: Number of blocks committed to an append blob

CamelAzureStorageBlobAppendOffset.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobAppendOffset.description: The offset at which the block was committed to the block blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobRawHttpHeaders.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobRawHttpHeaders.description: Returns non-parsed httpHeaders that can be used by the user.

CamelAzureStorageBlobFileName.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobFileName.description: The downloaded filename from the operation downloadBlobToFile.

CamelAzureStorageBlobDownloadLink.label: consumer
CamelAzureStorageBlobDownloadLink.description: The download link generated by downloadLink operation.

CamelAzureStorageBlobListBlobOptions.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobListBlobOptions.description: (listBlobs) Defines options available to configure the behavior of a call to listBlobsFlatSegment on a BlobContainerClient object.

CamelAzureStorageBlobListDetails.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobListDetails.description: (listBlobs) The details for listing specific blobs

CamelAzureStorageBlobPrefix.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobPrefix.description: (listBlobs,getBlob) Filters the results to return only blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix. May be null to return all blobs.

CamelAzureStorageBlobRegex.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobRegex.description: (listBlobs,getBlob) Filters the results to return only blobs whose names match the specified regular expression. May be null to return all. If both prefix and regex are set, regex takes the priority and prefix is ignored.

CamelAzureStorageBlobMaxResultsPerPage.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobMaxResultsPerPage.description: (listBlobs) Specifies the maximum number of blobs to return, including all BlobPrefix elements. If the request does not specify maxResultsPerPage or specifies a value greater than 5,000, the server will return up to 5,000 items.

CamelAzureStorageBlobTimeout.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobTimeout.description: (All) An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.

CamelAzureStorageBlobPublicAccessType.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobPublicAccessType.description: (createContainer) Specifies how the data in this container is available to the public. Pass null for no public access.

CamelAzureStorageBlobRequestCondition.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobRequestCondition.description: (Operations related to container and blob) This contains values which will restrict the successful operation of a variety of requests to the conditions present. These conditions are entirely optional.

CamelAzureStorageBlobBlobContainerName.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobBlobContainerName.description: (Operations related to container and blob) Override/set the container name on the exchange headers.

CamelAzureStorageBlobBlobName.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobBlobName.description: (Operations related to blob) Override/set the blob name on the exchange headers.

CamelAzureStorageBlobFileDir.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobFileDir.description: (downloadBlobToFile) The file directory where the downloaded blobs will be saved to.

CamelAzureStorageBlobPageBlobRange.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobPageBlobRange.description: (Operations related to page blob) A PageRange object. Given that pages must be aligned with 512-byte boundaries, the start offset must be a modulus of 512 and the end offset must be a modulus of 512 - 1. Examples of valid byte ranges are 0-511, 512-1023, etc.

CamelAzureStorageBlobPageBlobSize.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobPageBlobSize.description: (createPageBlob, resizePageBlob) Specifies the maximum size for the page blob, up to 8 TB. The page blob size must be aligned to a 512-byte boundary.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCommitBlobBlockList.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCommitBlobBlockList.description: (stageBlockBlobList) When is set to true, the staged blocks will not be committed directly.

CamelAzureStorageBlobBlockListType.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobBlockListType.description: (getBlobBlockList) Specifies which type of blocks to return.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCreateAppendBlob.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCreateAppendBlob.description: (commitAppendBlob) When is set to true, the append blocks will be created when committing append blocks.

CamelAzureStorageBlobCreatePageBlob.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobCreatePageBlob.description: (uploadPageBlob) When is set to true, the page blob will be created when uploading page blob.

CamelAzureStorageBlobDeleteSnapshotsOpti.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobDeleteSnapshotsOpti.description: (deleteBlob) Specifies the behavior for deleting the snapshots on this blob. Include will delete the base blob and all snapshots. Only will delete only the snapshots. If a snapshot is being deleted, you must pass null.

CamelAzureStorageBlobListBlobContainersO.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobListBlobContainersO.description: (listBlobContainers) A ListBlobContainersOptions which specifies what data should be returned by the service.

CamelAzureStorageBlobParallelTransferOpt.label: producer

CamelAzureStorageBlobDownloadLinkExpirat.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobDownloadLinkExpirat.description: (downloadLink) Override the default expiration (millis) of URL download link.

CamelAzureStorageBlobSourceBlobAccountNa.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobSourceBlobAccountNa.description: (copyBlob) The source blob account name to be used as source account name in a copy blob operation

CamelAzureStorageBlobSourceBlobContainer.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobSourceBlobContainer.description: (copyBlob) The source blob container name to be used as source container name in a copy blob operation

Note: A few events belonging to the previous hour can also be returned. A few events belonging to this hour can be missing; to ensure all events from the hour are returned, round the start time down by an hour.

Note: A few events belonging to the next hour can also be returned. A few events belonging to this hour can be missing; to ensure all events from the hour are returned, round the end time up by an hour.

CamelAzureStorageBlobContext.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageBlobContext.description: (getChangeFeed) This gives additional context that is passed through the Http pipeline during the service call.

regex.description: Filters the results to return only blobs whose names match the specified regular expression. May be null to return all if both prefix and regex are set, regex takes the priority and prefix is ignored.

serviceClient.description: Client to a storage account. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs and containers. This client contains operations on a service account. Operations on a container are available on BlobContainerClient through BlobServiceClient#getBlobContainerClient(String), and operations on a blob are available on BlobClient through BlobContainerClient#getBlobClient(String).

timeout.label: common
timeout.description: An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

blobSequenceNumber.label: producer
blobSequenceNumber.description: A user-controlled value that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 263 - 1.The default value is 0.

blockListType.label: producer
blockListType.description: Specifies which type of blocks to return.

changeFeedContext.label: producer
changeFeedContext.description: When using getChangeFeed producer operation, this gives additional context that is passed through the Http pipeline during the service call.

changeFeedEndTime.label: producer
changeFeedEndTime.description: When using getChangeFeed producer operation, this filters the results to return events approximately before the end time. Note: A few events belonging to the next hour can also be returned. A few events belonging to this hour can be missing; to ensure all events from the hour are returned, round the end time up by an hour.

changeFeedStartTime.label: producer
changeFeedStartTime.description: When using getChangeFeed producer operation, this filters the results to return events approximately after the start time. Note: A few events belonging to the previous hour can also be returned. A few events belonging to this hour can be missing; to ensure all events from the hour are returned, round the start time down by an hour.

closeStreamAfterWrite.label: producer
closeStreamAfterWrite.description: Close the stream after write or keep it open, default is true

commitBlockListLater.label: producer
commitBlockListLater.description: When is set to true, the staged blocks will not be committed directly.

createAppendBlob.label: producer
createAppendBlob.description: When is set to true, the append blocks will be created when committing append blocks.

createPageBlob.label: producer
createPageBlob.description: When is set to true, the page blob will be created when uploading page blob.

downloadLinkExpiration.label: producer
downloadLinkExpiration.description: Override the default expiration (millis) of URL download link.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: The blob operation that can be used with this component on the producer

pageBlobSize.label: producer
pageBlobSize.description: Specifies the maximum size for the page blob, up to 8 TB. The page blob size must be aligned to a 512-byte boundary.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure blob services

sourceBlobAccessKey.label: security
sourceBlobAccessKey.description: Source Blob Access Key: for copyblob operation, sadly, we need to have an accessKey for the source blob we want to copy Passing an accessKey as header, it's unsafe so we could set as key.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOperation.description: Specify the producer operation to execute. Different operations allowed are shown below.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRawHttpHeaders.description: Non parsed http headers that can be used by the user.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRequestConditio.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRequestConditio.description: This contains values which will restrict the successful operation of a variety of requests to the conditions present. These conditions are entirely optional.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeListPathOptions.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeListPathOptions.description: Defines options available to configure the behavior of a call to listContainersSegment on a DataLakeFileSystemClient object. Null may be passed.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakePath.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakePath.description: Path of the file to be used for upload operations.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRecursive.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRecursive.description: Specifies if the call to listContainersSegment should recursively include all paths.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeMaxResults.label: from user

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeUserPrincipalNa.label: from user

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileDir.label: from user

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentMD5.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentMD5.description: An MD5 hash of the content. The hash is used to verify the integrity of the file during transport.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeParallelTransfe.label: from user

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOpenOptions.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOpenOptions.description: Set of OpenOption used to configure how to open or create a file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeAccessTierChang.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeAccessTierChang.description: Datetime when the access tier of the blob last changed.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCacheControl.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCacheControl.description: Cache control specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentDisposit.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentDisposit.description: Content disposition specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentEncoding.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentEncoding.description: Content encoding specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentLanguage.label: from component

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentType.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeContentType.description: Content type specified for the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyProgress.label: from component

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeCopyStatusDescr.label: from component

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeEncryptionKeySh.label: from component

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeETag.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeETag.description: The E Tag of the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLastModified.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLastModified.description: Datetime when the file was last modified.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseDuration.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseDuration.description: Type of lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseState.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseState.description: State of the lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseStatus.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseStatus.description: Status of the lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeIncrementalCopy.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeIncrementalCopy.description: Flag indicating if the file was incrementally copied.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeServerEncrypted.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeServerEncrypted.description: Flag indicating if the file's content is encrypted on the server.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLinkExp.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLinkExp.description: Set the Expiration time of the download link.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLink.label: from component
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeDownloadLink.description: The link that can be used to download the file from datalake.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileOffset.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeFileOffset.description: The position where the data is to be appended.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseId.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeLeaseId.description: By setting lease id, requests will fail if the provided lease does not match the active lease on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakePathHttpHeaders.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakePathHttpHeaders.description: Additional parameters for a set of operations.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRetainCommitedD.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeRetainCommitedD.description: Determines Whether or not uncommitted data is to be retained after the operation.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeClose.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeClose.description: Whether or not a file changed event raised indicates completion (true) or modification (false).

CamelAzureStorageDataLakePosition.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakePosition.description: The length of the file after all data has been written.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeExpression.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeExpression.description: The query expression on the file.

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeInputSerializat.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeInputSerializat.description: Defines the input serialization for a file query request. either FileQueryJsonSerialization or FileQueryDelimitedSerialization

CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOutputSerializa.label: from user
CamelAzureStorageDataLakeOutputSerializa.description: Defines the output serialization for a file query request. either FileQueryJsonSerialization or FileQueryDelimitedSerialization

Component.name: azure-storage-queue
Component.title: Azure Storage Queue Service
Component.description: Stores and retrieves messages to/from Azure Storage Queue.

component.name: azure-storage-queue
component.title: Azure Storage Queue Service
component.description: Stores and retrieves messages to/from Azure Storage Queue.
component.label: cloud,messaging

serviceClient.label: common
serviceClient.description: Service client to a storage account to interact with the queue service. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. This client contains all the operations for interacting with a queue account in Azure Storage. Operations allowed by the client are creating, listing, and deleting queues, retrieving and updating properties of the account, and retrieving statistics of the account.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

createQueue.label: producer
createQueue.description: When is set to true, the queue will be automatically created when sending messages to the queue.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: Queue service operation hint to the producer

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

healthCheckConsumerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckConsumerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

healthCheckProducerEnabled.label: health
healthCheckProducerEnabled.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

maxMessages.label: queue
maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages to get, if there are less messages exist in the queue than requested all the messages will be returned. If left empty only 1 message will be retrieved, the allowed range is 1 to 32 messages.

messageId.label: queue
messageId.description: The ID of the message to be deleted or updated.

popReceipt.label: queue
popReceipt.description: Unique identifier that must match for the message to be deleted or updated.

timeout.label: queue
timeout.description: An optional timeout applied to the operation. If a response is not returned before the timeout concludes a RuntimeException will be thrown.

timeToLive.label: queue
timeToLive.description: How long the message will stay alive in the queue. If unset the value will default to 7 days, if -1 is passed the message will not expire. The time to live must be -1 or any positive number. The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S -- parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D -- parses as 2 days However, in case you are using EndpointDsl/ComponentDsl, you can do something like Duration.ofSeconds() since these Java APIs are typesafe.

visibilityTimeout.label: queue
visibilityTimeout.description: The timeout period for how long the message is invisible in the queue. The timeout must be between 1 seconds and 7 days. The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S -- parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D -- parses as 2 days However, in case you are using EndpointDsl/ComponentDsl, you can do something like Duration.ofSeconds() since these Java APIs are typesafe.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure queue services

credentials.label: security
credentials.description: StorageSharedKeyCredential can be injected to create the azure client, this holds the important authentication information

CamelAzureStorageQueueRawHttpHeaders.description: Returns non-parsed httpHeaders that can be used by the user.

CamelAzureStorageQueueMetadata.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueueMetadata.description: (createQueue) Metadata to associate with the queue

CamelAzureStorageQueueInsertionTime.description: The time the Message was inserted into the Queue.

CamelAzureStorageQueueExpirationTime.description: The time that the Message will expire and be automatically deleted.

CamelAzureStorageQueuePopReceipt.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueuePopReceipt.description: (deleteMessage, updateMessage) Unique identifier that must match for the message to be deleted or updated. If deletion fails using this pop receipt then the message has been dequeued by another client.

CamelAzureStorageQueueTimeNextVisible.description: The time that the message will again become visible in the Queue.

CamelAzureStorageQueueDequeueCount.description: The number of times the message has been dequeued.

CamelAzureStorageQueueOperation.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueueOperation.description: (All) Specify the producer operation to execute, please see the doc on this page related to producer operation.

CamelAzureStorageQueueTimeout.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueueTimeout.description: (All) An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.

CamelAzureStorageQueueMaxMessages.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueueMaxMessages.description: (receiveMessages, peekMessages) Maximum number of messages to get, if there are less messages exist in the queue than requested all the messages will be returned. If left empty only 1 message will be retrieved, the allowed range is 1 to 32 messages.

CamelAzureStorageQueueVisibilityTimeout.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueueVisibilityTimeout.description: (sendMessage, receiveMessages, updateMessage) The timeout period for how long the message is invisible in the queue. If unset the value will default to 0 and the message will be instantly visible. The timeout must be between 0 seconds and 7 days.

CamelAzureStorageQueueTimeToLive.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueueTimeToLive.description: (sendMessage) How long the message will stay alive in the queue. If unset the value will default to 7 days, if -1 is passed the message will not expire. The time to live must be -1 or any positive number.

CamelAzureStorageQueueCreateQueue.label: producer
CamelAzureStorageQueueCreateQueue.description: (sendMessage) When is set to true, the queue will be automatically created when sending messages to the queue.

accountName.description: Azure account name to be used for authentication with azure queue services

serviceClient.label: common
serviceClient.description: Service client to a storage account to interact with the queue service. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. This client contains all the operations for interacting with a queue account in Azure Storage. Operations allowed by the client are creating, listing, and deleting queues, retrieving and updating properties of the account, and retrieving statistics of the account.

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

createQueue.label: producer
createQueue.description: When is set to true, the queue will be automatically created when sending messages to the queue.

operation.label: producer
operation.description: Queue service operation hint to the producer

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

maxMessages.label: queue
maxMessages.description: Maximum number of messages to get, if there are less messages exist in the queue than requested all the messages will be returned. If left empty only 1 message will be retrieved, the allowed range is 1 to 32 messages.

messageId.label: queue
messageId.description: The ID of the message to be deleted or updated.

popReceipt.label: queue
popReceipt.description: Unique identifier that must match for the message to be deleted or updated.

timeout.label: queue
timeout.description: An optional timeout applied to the operation. If a response is not returned before the timeout concludes a RuntimeException will be thrown.

timeToLive.label: queue
timeToLive.description: How long the message will stay alive in the queue. If unset the value will default to 7 days, if -1 is passed the message will not expire. The time to live must be -1 or any positive number. The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S -- parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D -- parses as 2 days However, in case you are using EndpointDsl/ComponentDsl, you can do something like Duration.ofSeconds() since these Java APIs are typesafe.

visibilityTimeout.label: queue
visibilityTimeout.description: The timeout period for how long the message is invisible in the queue. The timeout must be between 1 seconds and 7 days. The format should be in this form: PnDTnHnMn.nS., e.g: PT20.345S -- parses as 20.345 seconds, P2D -- parses as 2 days However, in case you are using EndpointDsl/ComponentDsl, you can do something like Duration.ofSeconds() since these Java APIs are typesafe.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

repeatCount.label: consumer,scheduler
repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure queue services

credentials.label: security
credentials.description: StorageSharedKeyCredential can be injected to create the azure client, this holds the important authentication information

scope.description: Scope of bean. When using singleton scope (default) the bean is created or looked up only once and reused for the lifetime of the endpoint. The bean should be thread-safe in case concurrent threads is calling the bean at the same time. When using request scope the bean is created or looked up once per request (exchange). This can be used if you want to store state on a bean while processing a request and you want to call the same bean instance multiple times while processing the request. The bean does not have to be thread-safe as the instance is only called from the same request. When using delegate scope, then the bean will be looked up or created per call. However in case of lookup then this is delegated to the bean registry such as Spring or CDI (if in use), which depends on their configuration can act as either singleton or prototype scope. so when using prototype then this depends on the delegated registry.

This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

The bean does not have to be thread-safe as the instance is only called from the same request. When using prototype scope, then the bean will be looked up or created per call. lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

action.description: To configure the default cache action. If an action is set in the message header, then the operation from the header takes precedence.

createCacheIfNotExist.description: Automatic create the Caffeine cache if none has been configured or exists in the registry.

evictionType.description: Set the eviction Type for this cache

expireAfterAccessTime.description: Specifies that each entry should be automatically removed from the cache once a fixed duration has elapsed after the entry's creation, the most recent replacement of its value, or its last read. Access time is reset by all cache read and write operations. The unit is in seconds.

expireAfterWriteTime.description: Specifies that each entry should be automatically removed from the cache once a fixed duration has elapsed after the entry's creation, or the most recent replacement of its value. The unit is in seconds.

initialCapacity.description: Sets the minimum total size for the internal data structures. Providing a large enough estimate at construction time avoids the need for expensive resizing operations later, but setting this value unnecessarily high wastes memory.

key.description: To configure the default action key. If a key is set in the message header, then the key from the header takes precedence.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

maximumSize.description: Specifies the maximum number of entries the cache may contain. Note that the cache may evict an entry before this limit is exceeded or temporarily exceed the threshold while evicting. As the cache size grows close to the maximum, the cache evicts entries that are less likely to be used again. For example, the cache may evict an entry because it hasn't been used recently or very often. When size is zero, elements will be evicted immediately after being loaded into the cache. This can be useful in testing, or to disable caching temporarily without a code change. As eviction is scheduled on the configured executor, tests may instead prefer to configure the cache to execute tasks directly on the same thread.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

cacheLoader.description: To configure a CacheLoader in case of a LoadCache use

removalListener.label: advanced
removalListener.description: Set a specific removal Listener for the cache

statsCounter.label: advanced
statsCounter.description: Set a specific Stats Counter for the cache stats

statsEnabled.label: advanced
statsEnabled.description: To enable stats on the cache

valueType.label: advanced
valueType.description: The cache value type, default java.lang.Object

CamelCaffeineActionHasResult.description: The flag indicating whether the action has a result or not.

CamelCaffeineActionSucceeded.description: The flag indicating whether the action was successful or not.

CamelCaffeineKey.description: The key for all actions on a single entry.

CamelCaffeineKeys.description: The keys to get (GET_ALL), to invalidate (INVALIDATE_ALL) or existing (AS_MAP) according to the action.

CamelCaffeineValue.description: The value of key for all put actions (PUT or PUT_ALL).

CamelCaffeineOldValue.description: The old value returned according to the action.

allowContextMapAll.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.

allowTemplateFromHeader.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

ChunkResourceUri.description: A URI for the template resource to use instead of the endpoint configured.

ChunkTemplate.description: The template to use instead of the endpoint configured.

resourceUri.description: Path to the resource. You can prefix with: classpath, file, http, ref, or bean. classpath, file and http loads the resource using these protocols (classpath is default). ref will lookup the resource in the registry. bean will call a method on a bean to be used as the resource. For bean you can specify the method name after dot, eg bean:myBean.myMethod.

allowContextMapAll.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.

allowTemplateFromHeader.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.

contentCache.description: Sets whether to use resource content cache or not

encoding.description: Define the encoding of the body

extension.description: Define the file extension of the template

themeFolder.description: Define the themes folder to scan

themeLayer.description: Define the theme layer to elaborate

themeSubfolder.description: Define the themes subfolder to scan

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. scope.description: Scope of bean. When using singleton scope (default) the bean is created or looked up only once and reused for the lifetime of the endpoint. The bean should be thread-safe in case concurrent threads is calling the bean at the same time. When using request scope the bean is created or looked up once per request (exchange). This can be used if you want to store state on a bean while processing a request and you want to call the same bean instance multiple times while processing the request. The bean does not have to be thread-safe as the instance is only called from the same request. When using delegate scope, then the bean will be looked up or created per call. However in case of lookup then this is delegated to the bean registry such as Spring or CDI (if in use), which depends on their configuration can act as either singleton or prototype scope. so when using prototype then this depends on the delegated registry.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

The bean does not have to be thread-safe as the instance is only called from the same request. When using prototype scope, then the bean will be looked up or created per call. component.description: Send and receive messages to/from COAP capable devices.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

CamelCoapETag.description: The CoAP ETag for the response.

CamelCoapMaxAge.description: The CoAP Max-Age for the response body.

CamelCoapMethod.description: The request method that the CoAP producer should use when calling the target CoAP server URI. Valid options are DELETE, GET, PING, POST & PUT.

CamelCoapResponseCode.description: The CoAP response code sent by the external server. See RFC 7252 for details of what each code means.

CamelCoapUri.description: The URI of a CoAP server to call. Will override any existing URI configured directly on the endpoint.

uri.description: The URI for the CoAP endpoint

coapMethodRestrict.label: consumer
coapMethodRestrict.description: Comma separated list of methods that the CoAP consumer will bind to. The default is to bind to all methods (DELETE, GET, POST, PUT).

observable.label: consumer
observable.description: Make CoAP resource observable for source endpoint, based on RFC 7641.

observe.label: consumer
observe.description: Send an observe request from a source endpoint, based on RFC 7641.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

notify.label: producer
notify.description: Notify observers that the resource of this URI has changed, based on RFC 7641. Use this flag on a destination endpoint, with an URI that matches an existing source endpoint URI.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

alias.label: security
alias.description: Sets the alias used to query the KeyStore for the private key and certificate. This parameter is used when we are enabling TLS with certificates on the service side, and similarly on the client side when TLS is used with certificates and client authentication. If the parameter is not specified then the default behavior is to use the first alias in the keystore that contains a key entry. This configuration parameter does not apply to configuring TLS via a Raw Public Key or a Pre-Shared Key.

cipherSuites.label: security
cipherSuites.description: Sets the cipherSuites String. This is a comma separated String of ciphersuites to configure. If it is not specified, then it falls back to getting the ciphersuites from the sslContextParameters object.

clientAuthentication.label: security
clientAuthentication.description: Sets the configuration options for server-side client-authentication requirements. The value must be one of NONE, WANT, REQUIRE. If this value is not specified, then it falls back to checking the sslContextParameters.getServerParameters().getClientAuthentication() value.

privateKey.label: security
privateKey.description: Set the configured private key for use with Raw Public Key.

pskStore.label: security
pskStore.description: Set the PskStore to use for pre-shared key.

publicKey.label: security
publicKey.description: Set the configured public key for use with Raw Public Key.

recommendedCipherSuitesOnly.label: security
recommendedCipherSuitesOnly.description: The CBC cipher suites are not recommended. If you want to use them, you first need to set the recommendedCipherSuitesOnly option to false.

sslContextParameters.label: security
sslContextParameters.description: Set the SSLContextParameters object for setting up TLS. This is required for coapstcp, and for coaps when we are using certificates for TLS (as opposed to RPK or PKS).

trustedRpkStore.label: security
trustedRpkStore.description: Set the TrustedRpkStore to use to determine trust in raw public keys.
